title: JavaScript: The Good Parts
author: Douglas Crockford
description: This authoritative book provides a concise, in-depth look at JavaScript, a versatile language that can be used for web development, server-side programming, and more. The author presents the good parts of the language and explains why it is worth learning.

title: Eloquent JavaScript, 2nd Ed.
author: Marijn Haverbeke
description: This book is an introduction to programming in JavaScript, covering such topics as data structures, functions, and the browser environment. The second edition includes new chapters on Node.js, browser automation, and ECMAScript 6.

title: You Don't Know JS: Up & Going
author: Kyle Simpson
description: This book is the first in a series that provides a deep dive into the core mechanics of the JavaScript language. This volume covers the basics of JavaScript, including variables, values, functions, and control flow.

title: JavaScript and jQuery: Interactive Front-End Web Development
author: Jon Duckett
description: This book provides a comprehensive introduction to front-end web development using JavaScript and jQuery. It covers everything from basic JavaScript concepts to advanced jQuery techniques.

title: JavaScript: The Definitive Guide
author: David Flanagan
description: This comprehensive guide to JavaScript covers the language in depth, including its core features, object-oriented programming, and the latest ECMAScript standard. It also covers client-side and server-side programming, as well as web APIs.

title: Effective JavaScript: 68 Specific Ways to Harness the Power of JavaScript
author: David Herman
description: This book provides 68 specific ways to write better JavaScript code, covering topics such as data types, functions, objects, and code organization. It also includes tips for working with libraries and APIs.

title: JavaScript Patterns
author: Stoyan Stefanov
description: This book provides a deep dive into the world of JavaScript patterns, covering topics such as module patterns, design patterns, and anti-patterns. It also includes real-world examples and best practices for using patterns effectively.

title: Mastering JavaScript Functional Programming
author: Federico Kereki
description: This book covers the concepts and techniques of functional programming in JavaScript, including higher-order functions, closures, currying, and recursion. It also includes practical examples and case studies of functional programming in real-world scenarios.
